thread.title: The mansion featured in 'The Mary Tyler Moore Show' is up for sale
thread.title_full: The mansion featured in 'The Mary Tyler Moore Show' is up for sale - Business Insider

author: Peter Kiefer, The Hollywood Reporter
title: The mansion featured in 'The Mary Tyler Moore Show' is up for sale
text:
A fan takes a photo of the Minneapolis home which was the setting for the "Mary Tyler Moore" show is shown Wednesday, Jan. 25, 2017. Moore, who died Wednesday at the age of 80, played the part of Mary Richards, a producer for a fictional Minneapolis television station. AP Photo/Jim Mone
The stone Victorian Minneapolis-based mansion featured in " The Mary Tyler Moore Show " is for sale.
The exterior façade of the 9,500 square foot home that was built in 1900 was regularly featured on the hit show and is currently listed for $1.695 million.
Topped with a classical turret, the fictional home had bay windows and leaded glass transom accents. There are seven bedrooms and nine baths.
After a remodel, a chef’s kitchen was built with four ovens and an L-shaped, granite island.
The master suite features a fireplace, sitting and dressing rooms, and a spa-like bathroom. The home also offers a sauna and a rooftop deck with a hammock and five gas fireplaces. In the show, Mary’s actual apartment was a Hollywood set.
The three-story house last sold in 2007 for $2.8 million and was first put on the market in 2012, at $2.9 million.
The listing agents on the home are Barry Berg and Chad Larsen of Coldwell Banker Burnet .
